intro: Critesion nevskianum, commonly known as the Nevsky's cress, is a small flowering plant native to the Arctic and subarctic regions. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant typically grows in moist, rocky soils and is often found in alpine and tundra habitats. Its flowers are small and white or pale yellow, and it produces small, elongated pods that contain several seeds. Due to its limited distribution and specialized habitat, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
